meanings.definition: The action of preventing or prohibiting someone from doing something.
meanings.sent1: The debarment of the student from the school dance upset her.
meanings.sent2: His debarment from driving was a consequence of repeated traffic violations.
meanings.sent3: The debarment of the cat from the kitchen led to a hilarious chase around the house.
meanings.sent4: The debarment of the sun behind the clouds made the day feel gloomy.
meanings.sent5: The debarment of the noisy guest from the party brought peace and quiet to the room.

meanings.definition: The state of being excluded or disqualified from something.
meanings.sent1: After his debarment from the team, he felt disappointed but determined to improve.
meanings.sent2: Her debarment from the club left her feeling isolated and lonely.
meanings.sent3: The debarment of the dog from the couch resulted in a comical game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The debarment of the moon behind the clouds created a mysterious atmosphere in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The debarment of the mischievous squirrel from the bird feeder saved the seeds for the birds.
